raw_text:
Brizzel to run AAA's in Sheffield
 
 Ballymena sprinter Paul Brizzel will be among eight of Ireland's European Indoor hopefuls competing in this weekend's AAA's Championships.
 
 US-based Alistair Cragg and Mark Carroll are the only Irish athletes selected so far for the Europeans who will not run in Sheffield. Brizzel will defend his 200m title in the British trials. In-form James McIlroy will hope to confirm his place in the British team for Madrid by winning the 800m title. McIlroy has been in tremendous form on the European circuit in recent weeks. He is one of the fastest 800m runners in the world this winter and already seems assured of a place in Madrid. Corkman Mark Carroll confirmed in midweek that he would join Cragg in the European Championships. Carroll is ranked number three in the world 3000m ranking at the moment with Cragg occupying top spot. Meanwhile, nine-times champion Dermot Donnelly will not be coming out of retirement to compete in the Northern Ireland Cross Country Championships in Coleraine on Saturday. An injury crisis in the Annadale Striders squad led to Donnelly being entered by coach John McLaughlin but the athlete told BBC Sport on Friday evening that he would not be running. Willowfield's Paul Rowan will go in as individual favourite but Annadale could have a tough job holding on to their team title as Andrew Dunwoody and Noel Pollock are unlikely to run.
llama3.2:1b: Paul Brizzel, Paul Rowan, James McIlroy, Mark Carroll, Alistair Cragg, and Dermot Donnelly will compete in the AAA's Championships.
llama3.2:3b: Paul Brizzel will defend his 200m title at the AAA's Championships in Sheffield, while James McIlroy aims to secure his spot in the British team for Madrid by winning the 800m title. Mark Carroll will compete alongside Alistair Cragg at the Europeans, with Carroll ranked third in the world 3000m ranking.
gemma2:2b: Paul Brizzel will defend his 200m title at the AAA Championships, with eight Irish athletes competing in the event. Alistair Cragg and Mark Carroll are among the selected athletes for the European Indoor Championships but will not compete in Sheffield. James McIlroy is looking to secure a spot on the British team for Madrid's championships, while Mark Carroll's ranking makes him a notable competitor. Dermot Donnelly is withdrawing from competition due to an injury.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Paul Brizzel, an Irish sprinter, is among eight European indoor hopefuls competing in AAA's Championships this weekend in Sheffield. US-based athletes Alistair Cragg and Mark Carroll have been selected so far for the Europeans but not Brizzel or McIlroy. Dermot Donnelly will not be coming out of retirement to compete in Northern Ireland Cross Country Championships, while Colin Foster from Willowfield is an individual favourite but Annadale Striders' team may struggle with injuries.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Paul Brizzel, Irish sprinter, defending AAA's Championships 200m champion; James McIlroy hoping for British team selection in 800m after recent performances; Alistair Cragg and Mark Carroll selected by Ireland for European Indoor Championships but not running in Sheffield; Dermot Donnelly announced non-participation due to injury crisis, with John McLaughlin confirming Paul Rowan as leading contender.
qwen2.5:3b: Brizzel from Ballymena will compete at the AAA's Championships in Sheffield alongside Irish athletes Alistair Cragg, Mark Carroll, James McIlroy, and Dermot Donnelly (who won nine times previously). Carroll is ranked third globally in 3000m. McIlroy aims to qualify for European team in Madrid via 800m victory, while Donnelly won't participate due to injury issues within his squad. Paul Rowan from Willowfield is expected to win individually, but Annadale Striders might struggle with their team title given unlikely participation of Andrew Dunwoody and Noel Pollock.
